record.title: COMMITTEE ON SMALL BUSINESS AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP RULES OF PROCEDURE

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, Senate Standing Rule XXVI requires each committee to adopt rules to govern the procedures of the Committee and to publish those rules in the Congressional Record not later than March 1 of the first year of each Congress. Today, January 18, 2007, the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship held a business meeting during which the members of the committee unanimously adopted rules to govern the procedures of the committee. Consistent with Standing Rule XXVI, I am submitting for printing in the Congressional Record a copy of the Rules of the Senate Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship for the 110th Congress.

record.narrative: There being no objection, the material was ordered to be printed in the RECORD, as follows:
